element.name: Art's Cross by Windsockers, Traditional Cache (1/1.5)

long-description.p: Around 1600 a wayside cross (White Cross) was erected here by Dame Janet Dowdall, who was born at Athlumney, Navan. The cross features a crucifixion and Virgin and Child. The arms of the Dowdall and Bathe families are also incorporated
The cache is a micro container hidden at a safe distance from the cross please rehide it carefully to prevent puggles from dicovering its location.

ul.li:
2010-06-06T19:00:00Z : Found it by abra123cadabra
Should trust my GPSr. Couldn't see the cross where the sat nav indicated GZ. As per cache description it's not at the cross. Kind of creepy monument and indeed very old! Found together with photomaniac99 after the Arts in Action event at Townley Hall.

2010-06-02T19:00:00Z : Found it by thomasvm
Quick find. TFTC.

2010-04-11T19:00:00Z : Found it by niallk1234
Instant find, first of 3 for today. Thanks for the cache.

2010-04-01T19:00:00Z : Found it by poohbear50
Quick find. TFTC

2010-04-01T19:00:00Z : Found it by Wild Rover
Quick find as we started to turn for home. TFTC

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Art's Cross
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Around 1600 a wayside cross (White Cross) was erected here by Dame Janet Dowdall, who was born at Athlumney, Navan. The cross features a crucifixion and Virgin and Child. The arms of the Dowdall and Bathe families are also incorporated

The Cache

The cache is a micro container hidden at a safe distance from the cross please rehide it carefully to prevent puggles from dicovering its location.




The Windsockers

Instant find, first of 3 for today. Thanks for the cache.
